localize.text: (Netzach is not showing up)
Why is the meeting room so far?
Uh, you know my name, right?
Do you have anything else to say?
Yes.
No.
Uh, could we talk later? I am kind of busy at the moment.
That’s good. See you later.
You look little dumbfounded.
Aren't you supposed to tell us that you're honored to have this job and such?
Well, nobody wants to hear that.
That's right, I will tell you straight. I don't like my job.
I really want to quit.
But I can’t, can I?
I came here against my will.
I don’t know about you, though.
Me, the first thing I remember is this place.
I don't want to be responsible for someone's death.
Whoever assigned me here, they were totally wrong.
I feel helpless.
Employees die everyday.
There will be no one to remember them.
No one will commemorate their sacrifice.
(Netzach closed his eyes)
When I close my eyes, I feel like I am in a different world.
I belonged to a different world once.
I once worked hard to save people, you know.
But I am here now.
What is the meaning of saving someone's life only to see the person dies the next day?
What is the point of delaying the inevitable?
The people here have no future.
You know, those little things called plans.
Making money, finding your love, getting married, having kids.
Do you know how it feels like playing the Russian roulette every day?
Watching others die is a pain. Surviving the day is a pain.
We're just lemmings running toward the cliff.
Speaking of lemmings, can we have a beer vending machine?
It's like the only thing that makes me happy here.
I can do that.
You know I can't.
Manager, please. You're a better person than Netzach here.
What's wrong with you? I am just trying to improve the welfare of employees.
You're out of your line, Netzach. Consider this a friendly warning.
Why don't you just scrap me?
Yeah, ignore me all you want. How typical.
Um... Netzach is not feeling well today, I came here to tell that...
Malkuth, you're a terrible liar. Manager, Netzach is high on Enkephalin. He's completely wasted.
You're a rat!
You know what? It is not my concern.
Please, don't tell Angela about this.
Netzach is neglecting his responsibilities and so is you. Shouldn't you be in the team meeting in the first place?
Right! Thanks, Yesod!
Please don't be offended, but you should do something before Angela sees Netzach this wasted.
(Found Netzach)
What's up? You look super today. So, you.. uh... succeeded something, huh? Far out, man.
Why is the ground shaking? Another breach?
I know what you're thinking.
Netzach is just a pathetic junkie, not like Malkuth or Yesod, right?
I know, I read your mind.
I get that a lot.
But, think about it.
This place is hell.
Is it that wrong trying to escape from the reality even for a moment?
I mean, we should celebrate for surviving another shitty day!
I don't care about the future of the company or anything like that.
There is no tomorrow here.
What did I do wrong?
Am I being punished for my sins?
I repent before you! Please, I repent...
I want to see this place crumbling into pieces.
Netzach did it again, Angela!
Netzach did what?
He just gave me the report for our joint operation; it was due yesterday.
And I can’t find him anywhere now. I’m sure he is sleeping somewhere, drunk as hell.
The upper Sephirahs will know where he is, go ask them.
I don’t want to talk to them!
Angela, I think Netzach is lacking in too many to be a good Sephirah.
What’s your point, Tiphereth?
...I am asking you to replace Netzach.
Tiphereth.
The replacement process cannot be used to remove Sephirahs you don’t like.
If I could do that, I would have replaced most of the Sephirahs.
Sephirahs can only bey replaced when they have serious flaws and cannot perform their duties.
Netzach meets the conditions, he’s not doing anything..
Netzach is doing his part. It is his role to get drunk by Enkephalin, or to become lethargic.
One more, Tiphereth. Even if we replaced Netzach, do you really think the new Netzach would be a diligent, hard working Sephirah?
Please don’t talk about the replacement process so simply.
I know how you feel, but Netzach is a different problem.
Tiphereth, I have headache, could you please not shout?
I told Angela, about the replacement process!
Your days of irresponsibility will soon be over!
You think I’d be scared of your threat? I hate to disappoint you...
That is exactly what I want, Tiphereth. Don’t you get it?
....Do you really think you can say that when you are completely cornered?
I don’t care whether you succeeded or not....
Maybe Angela is regretting as well.
I feel the same as Tiphereth.
Why haven’t I been destroyed? Angela could replace me anytime she wants.
If I were Angela, I would have destroyed an AI like me a long time ago.
Well, that’s awkward.
I don’t expect you to say something to me, so don't worry about it.
Be honest, you are not meeting me to get praised, are you?
Aren’t you sick of it?
You will do something great tomorrow again, well, it won’t be that great, but Angela and other Sephirahs will compliment you.
We will have another accident in my department, some will die, some will go nuts, and some will sustain unrecoverable injuries.
Hod will cheer me up. Yesod will lecture me about the rules I did not follow. Malkuth will encourage me saying let’s try harder from tomorrow.
Nobody will say it’s my fault, but it is my fault, definitely.
My day repeats like that.
It starts with death and ends with death.
All the employees here regularly receive a small dose of a drug. Did you know?
It helps them become desensitized to everything.
Think about it. If your lunchmate is found dead, torn into thousands pieces, who can clean his dead body without feeling anything?
Can you blame them? Can you blame them for depending those drugs?
Everybody is trying their best to bury their heads in the sand.
They might look okay, but nobody really is.
I keep thinking of how can I die.
I know, it is like a metaphor. Death to us is hypothetical.
I heard injecting drugs like Enkephalin into the machine will slowly rust it.
Then, if I put a whole bottle into my body,
it will cause irreversible damage to me.
I just injected myself with way more Enkephalin than I usual do,
but my mind is clear. I feel completely lucid right now.
If I open my eyes again, maybe it’s somewhere without you, other Sephirahs, or Angela.
It wasn’t fun. Let’s never meet again.
We started a full research on Cogito. The main issue was to find the proper drug dosage.
I persuaded people. I told them we should proceed with the experiment in order to save Carmen and the others.
Everybody kept quiet when I asked for volunteers. One silently raised his hand.
It was Giovanni, who had kept to himself most of the time.
Giovanni was one of the patients from Carmen’s company. I heard they knew each other since they were young.
There is no noble sacrifice. The end is always miserable, no matter how justifiable the reason is.
Maybe he decided to volunteer for the experiment, when I said it might save Carmen.
The experiment to find proper drug dosages is not something that can be done in a short time.
I did not talk with him much. We had little in common, mostly just Carmen.
Cogito lowers a person's boundary,
and repeated experiments leaves an indelible mark.
Inject Cogito.
Inject Cogito.
Inject Cogito.
If Carmen was here, she would laugh so hard to see the two of us talking.
I mean, we never really talked to each other.
From the beginning, I came here because of Carmen, not you.
I hope I can revive Carmen back to life.
We couldn’t save Carmen.
We knew it from the very start.
I did not answer him because I did not want to ruin his only hope.
That was my selfishness, believing he would be happy in a dream that he could not wake from while in a restless sleep.
So the reason I am facing you is because I definitely failed on the experiment.
I will find another method next time.
...I am kidding, don’t tell this to Angela or the other Sephirahs. That will only lead to trouble.
I hear treatment is needed because the parts was full of Enkephalin.
It will probably be difficult.
A bit painful as well.
To be honest, I didn’t want to wake up. It’s been a while since I’ve had such a long sleep.
But somewhere deep in my flickering consciousness, someone called out to me.
The familiar voice said this.
“No, you can’t. In here, you must ask for my permission for even death."
And then you saved me.
Sadly, I opened my eyes again.
This place will never be safe.
It’s no use, even if everyone tries.
Well, we have a conclusion.
It is to live.
Even though life is full of pain, if the voice that called to me wants us to find and hold on to a shed of possibility,
then what else is there to do but to follow the voice's wish?
From the get-go, I was disdainful of you, did you know?
But for the first time, I'm thinking perhaps it is I that called you.
You came to ruin me, but also to save me.
I think we are in a similar situation.
We are both caught up in the sins of our past.
It is not I who has changed.
You are the one who is finally seeing clearly.
